Congressional Favorability

As of 9/27/2015 27%

Date Favorable Unfavorable 2/12/1995 53 37 6/11/1995 53 42 8/20/1995 45 47 10/30/1995 42 55 1/14/1996 42 54 4/25/1996 44 50 6/9/1996 45 50 1/12/1997 55 40 2/24/1997 51 40 5/18/1997 49 42 6/22/1997 52 42 8/10/1997 50 44 9/10/1998 66 27 10/18/1998 61 34 12/13/1998 52 41 1/17/1999 48 45 2/21/1999 52 44 6/14/1999 56 39 9/9/1999 63 34 1/7/2001 65 23 6/13/2004 56 32 7/18/2005 49 40 10/24/2005 45 45 2/5/2006 44 47 1/9/2007 53 38 7/29/2007 41 51 5/25/2008 41 51 1/11/2009 39 52 4/21/2009 49 43 8/27/2009 37 52 2/9/2010 41 50 3/1/2011 34 57 8/21/2011 25 70 1/16/2012 23 69 7/9/2012 27 65 12/9/2012 27 67 1/13/2013 23 68 7/21/2013 21 70 10/13/2013 23 73 12/8/2013 27 67 2/26/2014 23 72 7/14/2014 28 69 12/7/2014 22 71 03/29/2015 22 72 09/27/2015 27 69

Approval of Congress remains low, with just 27% of the public expressing a favorable opinion (up 22% from March 2015). Positive views of Congress have remained below 30% for more than three years. Read more.
